thread.title: Steve Wozniak says Michael Fassbender's Steve Jobs film is inaccurate: "Everything in the movie didn't happen" - Movies
thread.title_full: Steve Wozniak says Michael Fassbender's Steve Jobs film is inaccurate: "Everything in the movie didn't happen" - Movies News - Digital Spy

author: Justin Harp
title: Steve Wozniak says Michael Fassbender's Steve Jobs film is inaccurate: "Everything in the movie didn't happen" - Movies
text: Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak is a fan of Michael Fassbender's Steve Jobs - even though he thinks it's inaccurate.Wozniak is the latest key figure to weigh in on the biopic, after Apple's design chief Jony Ive and current CEO Tim Cook criticised Danny Boyle's new film. © Getty ImagesSteve Wozniak Speaking to Bloomberg TV, Wozniak acknowledged that many of the events in the movie do not match his own recollection. "Everything in the movie didn't happen," he insisted. "Every scene that I'm in, I wasn't talking to Steve Jobs at those events."The tech pioneer added that he did meet with actor Seth Rogen about his portrayal, explaining: "It's the artistic freedom to make a movie that is enjoyable."We had meetings on multiple occasions… tiny, tiny bits that were somewhere else kind of got used by him and painted by him in a different way and a different place." © UniversalSeth Rogen and Michael Fassbender in Steve Jobs Steve Jobs review: Michael Fassbender is savagely compelling In spite of these criticisms, Wozniak praised Fassbender for capturing the "brilliance" of Jobs.The biopic comes from the power-house duo of acclaimed director Danny Boyle and the Oscar-winning screenwriter Aaron Sorkin.Steve Jobs is on limited release in the US and bows in the UK on November 13.
